intro: Petrocosmea heterophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaved rock orchid, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique, often hairy leaves that vary in shape and size. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pale green or yellowish, with a distinct scent that attracts specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
